309.question: What was the performance of their model?
309.response: {'Answer': 'The performance of their model "Ours with Mask and Ordered Triplets" had the highest scores with 61.17% EM, 93.54% F1, and 61.36% GM on the Test-Repeated Set, and 41.71% EM, 90.22% F1, and 41.81% GM on the Test-New Set.'}
309.answer: For test-repeated set, EM score of 61.17, F1 of 93.54, ED of 0.75 and GM of 61.36. For test-new set, EM score of 41.71, F1 of 91.02, ED of 1.22 and GM of 41.81

312.question: How were the navigation instructions collected?
312.response: {'Answer': 'The navigation instructions were likely collected by observing several paths in different environment layouts and encoding these paths as behavioral graphs, possibly with associated natural language instructions. Models were then trained to predict navigation behaviors based on these graphs and instructions.'}
312.answer: using Amazon Mechanical Turk using simulated environments with topological maps
